title: 115_hr3077
content: The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals the Retirement Earnings Test. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals various subsections of the Social Security Act and makes conforming amendments to Section 203. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" repeals and amends subsections of the Social Security Act, including changes to benefits termination upon deportation and exemptions from reductions based on early retirement. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" amends provisions related to early retirement and exemptions from reductions in Social Security benefits. The "Senior Citizens' Freedom to Work Act of 2017" amends various sections of the Social Security Act, including provisions related to suspension of aliens' benefits, reductions in benefits based on maximum benefits, and penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings. The Social Security Act is amended to include provisions related to penalties for misrepresentations concerning earnings for periods subject to deductions on account of work. The Social Security Act is amended to include provisions related to benefit computation years, rounding of benefits, and defining income for purposes of SSI. The Social Security Act is amended to include provisions related to benefit computation years, rounding of benefits, and defining income for purposes of SSI. The term 'wages' for paragraph (1)(A) is defined without regard to certain limitations on remuneration amounts specified in section 209(a). Services not constituting employment under section 210 are deemed employment if remuneration is not included in net earnings or net loss calculations for title II. The Social Security Act is amended to exclude certain services from computing an individual's net earnings or losses for self-employment under title II. The term 'wages' is redefined to exclude retirement payments or benefits upon termination of employment due to retirement. Additionally, deductions related to work under the Railroad Retirement Program are repealed. The Railroad Retirement Act of 1974 is amended to remove certain subsections and make conforming amendments. The changes apply to taxable years ending after December 31, 2018.
